modules.description: This module supports set algebra (union, intersection, difference), element-wise queries (membership checks, min/max retrieval), and transformations (filtering, mapping) on ordered collections of repository values. It employs a set data structure that enforces uniqueness and sorted traversal via a comparator, with utilities to convert between sets, lists, and sequences while preserving order. Typical applications include managing repository groups with strict membership rules, enabling bulk updates through set operations, or processing repositories in a deterministic sequence for synchronization tasks.

This module represents GitHub repositories using a tuple type and provides operations to create, compare, and manipulate repository identifiers. It works directly with repository values and supports set-based operations through the `Set` submodule for managing unique collections. Concrete use cases include tracking repository membership in webhook events, applying bulk actions across sets of repositories, and ensuring consistent repository identity checks.

This module implements a GitHub webhook handler that manages repository events. It provides operations to create a webhook instance, register repositories to watch with specific event types, and process incoming events. The handler works with repository sets, event hooks, and time-based configurations, supporting asynchronous execution and event waiting via Lwt.

This module handles GitHub webhook events with functions for validating payloads, parsing event types, and managing repository identifiers. It works with repository tuples and set-based structures for membership checks and bulk operations. Concrete use cases include processing push events across multiple repositories, filtering events by repository, and managing secure webhook endpoints with TLS configuration.
